subject: Re: [junit] How to Test Private Methods Inside a Class
msgSnippet: ... No reason we can t have both. Also, why do I have to write that loop every time? How often have you wanted to read only one line from that BufferedReader?
messageBody:
Joakim Ohlrogge wrote:

> > (Does Java 5 have a built-in
> > library method for loading a text file yet?!)

> I kind of like the way you do it in Java, create a BufferedReader and
> use readLine(). I think the Stream abstraction is really elegant and
> much prefer to work with it than directly with files.

No reason we can't have both.

Also, why do I have to write that loop every time? How often have you
wanted to read only one line from that BufferedReader? Where the hell is
BufferedReader.readLines() that returns an array or List of lines?!

> Of course, that is just one mans opinion that may change after working
> with Ruby,

That's always possible.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
